{"step_by_step_thinking": "Anaphylaxis is a severe allergic reaction that can be life-threatening. It is mediated by the immune system. 5-hydroxytryptamine, also known as serotonin, is a neurotransmitter that can be involved in allergic reactions, but it is not the primary mediator of anaphylaxis. Heparin is an anticoagulant, not a mediator of anaphylaxis. Prostaglandins are a group of lipids that can play a role in inflammation and allergic reactions, but again, they are not the primary mediators of anaphylaxis. Therefore, none of these options are the primary mediators of anaphylaxis.", "answer_choice": "D. All of these"}
